intro: Fleischmannia soratae, commonly known as the Santa Barbara dudleya, is a succulent plant native to the coastal regions of southern California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves that are typically blue-gray in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are often pink or purple, blooming in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
